intro: Mesembryanthemum edwardsiae, commonly known as the Cape marigold, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, featuring a shallow root system and thick leaves that store water. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its blooming period typically occurs during the cooler months, adding vibrant color to coastal and Mediterranean climates.
